website_summaries.verdict: A great look for an affordable price. The best value you can find in a dressy shoe with lasting comfort.
pros: A popular shoe by a trusted name in men's clothing
Gets our top marks for padded comfort and quality leather construction at a mid-range price point
cons: Compared to the quality of the shoe, the laces don't match up, but this is a minor concern

customer_reviews.title: I'm a typical guy - I find something I like and I buy it over and over again
customer_reviews.text: I'm a typical guy - I find something I like and I buy it over and over again. Something has gone wrong with these shoes. First pair fit well, so I ordered more. Pair 3 had the inner structure of the left heel fail. I ordered two more thinking this was a fluke. The next pair lasted six weeks. Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Steinbach

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not what it used to be. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I had been buying these same shoes for years, as I found them to be comfortable and last a long time. In the past year, however, something changed dramatically. The shoes were lasting a few weeks, at most. As others have also reported, they would develop cracks in the heel, the upper would separate from the lower, the insole would press right through into the back of heel, warping the heel. The company sent me a replacement pair, those were defective before I ever put them on (the heel was separating). They sent another replacement. Those lasted a few months of occasional use, and now have the same problem. The company refuses to do anything more.
customer_reviews.author: Noam

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this exact same pair of shoes in brown for several years of day-to-day use. I liked them so much that when it was time for some new black oxfords, I decided to buy the same shoe. That was a mistake. While they look and fit just as well as the old ones, the construction quality has obviously declined. Within the first couple months (outside the manufacturer warranty and Amazon return window, of course) the air cushions in both shoes have burst. Every step is accompanies by a loud rush of air from the soles. My older brown ones are still going strong. My advice: Steer clear unless they bring their quality back up.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: The most uncomfortable loafer I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, these shoes are quite fashionable and suited my style nicely. My love affair with these shoes quickly turned into a nightmare. On my first over night business trip with these shoes (I brought no other dress shoes with me), they hurt my feet so badly that by the end of the day, my big toe knuckles were bleeding through my socks. I had to suffer through that both days until I finally got home and pitched these shoes into the “Goodwill” pile. They were horrible. The most uncomfortable shoes I’ve ever worn in my 53 years on earth. The fit was fine, but they are unyielding and rock hard to the touch. Be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Toler

customer_reviews.title: The brown/cordovan pair are stiff and painful - get the black pair!!
customer_reviews.text: I started with a black pair from the retail store. They fit great and we're super comfortable. I needed a replacement pair in black. They arrived and they fit well. I wanted a brown pair of these. Even after ALMOST A YEAR, the cordovan ones are just as stiff!!! Another note, the insoles aren't good for the callous behind your big toe. The Heel is good but the front of the insole is rough. I just replaced them with other ones from the store and work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Alive and Well

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get a better quality shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes looked good at first. I have had them for 3 weeks and it litteraly feels like they are falling apart. I walk about 3 miles a day at my job and these are not god if you walk around allot .The bottom sole looks like it's wasting already , stitching is falling apart and I could swear one shoe feels tighter than the other. If you just sit at your desk all day you could probably make them last a few months but if you move around allot I would skip these and spend a little more and buy a better quality shoe, would I reccomend these ? Absolutely not! Im already looking to replace this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rogelio Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes first time I bought a Wide shoe and wow what a difference!
customer_reviews.text: I am a retail mgr and on my feet 10 hours a day. I always bought Ecco brand before and paid 3X as much as these Dockers. The Ecco's are good but these are just as good and look just as nice. I ended up getting a black and brown pair. I am 6'3, 220 and decided to try the wide width....oh yes good choice. I am a size 12 and I will be wide from now on...... feels so much better! I am not sure I "need" the wide shoe technically, but if they feel this good....I will always get wide going forward! They fit dead on for me in all three areas listed above.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Rawlings

customer_reviews.title: Solid affordable good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear black dress shoes often, but I'm not one to think about what shoes I'm wearing before I decide to walk a mile rather than drive, or worry about walking through snow, mud, or puddles. Consequently, I'll clean them up and shine them until they're worn out (or stolen). These replaced my "utility shoes"; the go to, everyday, looks good with a black, dark gray, or navy suit, pair. I've only had them a week, but compared to the last few pairs I've bought (not Dockers) they're solid and they seem like they'll last long. I'll update the review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: interior isn't really that comfortable, and they feel pretty cheap
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have basically nothing special going for them. No support, interior isn't really that comfortable, and they feel pretty cheap. They look great but even in as little as one month I see they are wrinkling and showing wear. Mind you I work in an office and move a bit, but not enough to warrant the wear of these shoes. The only great things about them are that they come in wide varieties and they're cheap. If you sit at your desk all day they're a great pair of shoes for a budget... but if you need to walk a lot don't bother. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and won’t last
customer_reviews.text: They look great and are comfortable. However, after less than 3 months of wearing them only 4 days per week the soles have separated from the shoes necessitating their replacement. I’m sorry I wasted the money on these poor quality shoes!
customer_reviews.author: B. Money

customer_reviews.title: I loved these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes. I feel old saying this... But they dont make them like they used to. I bought these same shoes 15 years ago and they lasted 13 years with light use (once a week for church) then 2 years with heavier use (weekdays for work). Those ones worked so well for so long I wanted the same ones again. So I bought these same exact ones. But they only lasted a few months before they wore down enough to get a hole in the heel and everytime I stepped you would hear the air push out from the heel part. It was super annoying. So I had to go with a different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: They could make them A LOT better.
customer_reviews.text: I wear out the outside of my heel if the heel material isn't really durable. I haven't had these too long, but it is wearing out too early. Took 3 days to break in, and laces broke too soon. The grommets are sharp on the inside which cut the laces that came with them. They could make them a little better. Soles wear out WAY TOO quickly! Update 12 12 2015: terrible quality-DO NOT RECOMMEND BUYING-they don't last. The soles are almost gone. I've worn other shoes for over a year and they lasted way better. DO NOT BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.author: pac

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Classic Design!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very well made. Most shoes at this price point are made of a thinner leather and feel a little flimsy. These are substantial! The leather is nice and shines easily. They are a bit stiff and will take time to break in. My only complaint is the laces. They're thicker and have a tendency to come untied. As they soften up, that should also go away. I spent a lot of time looking and took a chance on these. I'm glad I did. They compare well to shoes that cost 4-5x more. I like them as a business casual shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Rigo Delgadillo

customer_reviews.title: Just a good basic shoe for work
customer_reviews.text: My foot size tends to be wide with most shoes, so I was a little concerned ordering a shoe online sight unseen. However, the fit is flawless, and as comfortable out of the box as a shoe of this style ever is. I appreciate that they don't have a toe box that could double as a hangar for a 737--I've passed on more office casual-type shoes than I care to recount, simply because for some reason giant pointed clown shoes have become fashionable. This is an easy choice if you work in an office environment--unless you're one of those people who have to have some big-name designer build you some ridiculous shoes that make you look like a court jester.
customer_reviews.author: Sarcasmo

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews I’ve read most of them are true, nice looking shoe, wore it for the first time today for about 6 hrs, walked about 8,000 step no problems in comfort. I read about other reviews on the shoe strings so I went out and bought me a pair before they arrived. The shoe strings that came with the shoe was hefty shoe strings, I see no problem in keeping them on the shoe but after all it was my first time. I can see myself buying these shoes again. Very nice leather dress shoe
customer_reviews.author: Milton E.

customer_reviews.title: Good look, comfortable, wears out too soon
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I've owned. The first lasted me for five years of occasional use (about one day a week). The uppers have lasted wonderfully. The rubber sole on both shoes cracked where the heel meets the midsole, progressing until the rubber had cracked all the way through and the upper separated from the sole. Given that the leather upper was still in great shape, this was a disappointing end to the shoes; the damage was irreparable. But I'll take a chance on another pair, and at this price point, five years of service isn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Kagen

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe. Fits as expected. It has moderate arch support. But I need more and there is enough space for me to comfortably add store bought orthotics in them. Reasonably comfortable. Another good point is the sole is not made of leather (not sure why people like leather soles as they absorb moisture from sidewalks). Normally I would give 4 stars. But I am giving it 5 stars because of the great price.
customer_reviews.author: Chicagoan

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, walked 8000 steps on the first day wearing, no problem, great shoes
customer_reviews.text: The color is slightly different from what is shown on the website, in real life it is a bit lighter with reddish in it and frankly looks better. I had these shoes for a month and finally started to wear them. When I put them on in the morning, they felt a bit stiff and tight, but I spent a whole day walking in them, about 8000 steps without realizing it. Good shoes, well finished, look the same as shoes double the price, time will tell if they will hold up at least half a year wear.
customer_reviews.author: David_A

customer_reviews.title: After 8 Years
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on August 29, 2011. I used them mostly for dress occasions, but for a while they were my primary work shoe. I went about two years without wearing them until today when I pulled them out of the closet to wear them once again. Unfortunately, as soon as I started walking on hard ground I could hear cracking. The bottom hard sole was literally crumbling beneath my weight. Despite the fact they eventually gave out, I still give 4 stars because 8 years is a pretty long time to last for a budget shoe. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I have had them for almost a year now and they fit and wear wonderfully. They look really good and professional and have given e zero problems. The bottoms are even wearing very little as can be problem with some footwear. I can say that the black ones have some surface wear on the toes much faster than the brown ones. This is nothing that polish cannot fix. The only problem I have out of these is the sole slipping out of the front when I remove them. It does not come all of the way out but it is still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Same Shoes... Every time.
customer_reviews.text: I like finding things that work well, and I like how they fit and feel. Makes shopping easy. Same thing, every time. Easy to rebuy, and you know what you are getting. Simple. Not the most comfortable, but tolerable, and they don't make my feet hurt, as other shoes do. Easy to shine up in the airport. Last 90-120 days, everyday use, 8-10 hours a day, M-F. Low Cost to replace.
customer_reviews.author: James Jones

customer_reviews.title: 30 year customer
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. After buying this shoe for over 30 years as my primary work shoe, yes it fit as expected :) I have noticed over time some changes that cheapen the shoe. The heel is hollow and thinner material so it wears through and a hole appears where the heel wears down. Also the sole material wears faster. Given that I still buy them, in wide , for my 10.5 size foot, because they wear comfortably and still look like real material leather shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Schilling

customer_reviews.title: Update: I've bought 6, nope, now 8 pairs over the years... the only thing I'd wish they'd fix is...
customer_reviews.text: Update: bought two more pair today. Let's see if those soles are any better. I've bought 3 pairs of brown and 3 pairs of black over the years and I continue to love these shoes. They keep a polish very nicely and the uppers are durable and long lasting. The first thing to go on these shoes is always the soles... long before the uppers are ready to be done. First they split acrossways at the ball of the foot, then the heel wears out exposing the structure of the heel.
customer_reviews.author: John Asendorf

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe, lasts for about a year of daily use, great price
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these shoes for the last 10 years or so. Each pair lasts about a year of wearing to work every day. The heals tend to wear through the bottom layer exposing a sort of cavity, and the black coloring on the leather tends to wear off in one or two places in about the year's timeframe. Given the price, I keep going back to this brand. They are reasonable comfortable after you break them in for a day. The uppers seem like they ar real leather. I think if I were to buy more expensive shoes, they would last about the same amount of time, so these are a good deal I think.
customer_reviews.author: MartyB

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: Had these shoes since July, so 4 months. I only wear these to work, 5 days a week. These already have holes in the heal from wear and the leather is starting to separate from the soles. I do not drag my feet or do anything that would make them wear this way - complete waste of money. I have purchase this brand, style and size for years and this never happened in the past. Won't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: Buy plenty of Shoestrings.
customer_reviews.text: I've order these shoes online twice now. The first pair had a quirk I thought was just unlucky for me. The first eyelet's grommet or aglet was poorly punch or was just substandard. Regardless, the inside edge of the metal junction kept cutting my shoestring. I tried multiple things to smooth the surface but the metal was not hard enough to stay smooth and kept cutting. I finally wore through those shoes and decided to buy another pair. I've owned them for two months and I already need new shoestings for the same problem. Funny thing, this happend to the right shoe on the last pair, now its the left. Otherwise, the shoes are great.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Gerhard

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes w/o the the liner
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way these shoes look and the fact that they come in a nice cordovan as well as the black. I got one pair of each color. I have wide feet, and these shoes were a little snug right out of the box. I removed the liner (which just pulled out, it was not sewn or glued in), and they fit great! Best looking and fitting shoes for casual/dress that I have seen at such a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa D & Nana

customer_reviews.title: These shoes were excruciatingly painful. The fit was perfect but there was a ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were excruciatingly painful. The fit was perfect but there was a hard piece of leather in the front by the tongue that would not break in. It ultimately broke me leaving me with a scar that has been in place for a few months now. Definitely do NOT recommend unless you really enjoy bleeding.
customer_reviews.author: David Van Wart

customer_reviews.title: Good looks and plenty of support at the right price. What else can I say!?
customer_reviews.text: They dont just sound good in writing, waite until you get complimented on them. You almost feel guilty knowing what you paide for them, almost i said. Being an amputee I only have one foot on the ground, I need to know that my footing is secure, my feet are comfortable and the price is right. The sole flexes such as to provide that comfort but is thick and sturdy enough to provide a very good amount of anti-penetration my anything old ,filtfilthy and rusty. I just ordered 3 more pair of black ones for up and coming birthday parties and a pair of browns for me muself.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Morales

customer_reviews.title: Initially uncomfortable, but improved with wear
customer_reviews.text: The first several times I wore these to work I had to keep a back-up pair of shoes on hand to change into midway through the day. These shoes did cause me some foot pain initially and I cannot say they were comfortable shoes out of the box. However, the shoes have improved with wear (took about 5 attempts before I could wear them through the work day). The shoes are exceptionally nice looking, which is why I gave them a chance despite being uncomfortable to wear at first. They are a deep reddish-brown color and hold a shine very well.
customer_reviews.author: Growler-577

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfy but cheap looking
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable because of the full rubber sole and heel. But they look cheap/ inexpensive. I was in an elevator with colleagues and looked down at these shoes and compared them to the others and they looked cheap. Good shoes to wear on a rainy day or when doing heavy walking. Would not wear them if pitching new business to prospects/ clients. -Update: After first outing in the rain, the leather wrinkled. Shoes are un-useable now
customer_reviews.author: wmont

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair! The first 2 pairs each lasted over 5 years! I basically wore out a black pair and a brown pair over 5-6 years, so I decided just to buy another pair because I know how well they are made! They can take a few days to break in if you have wider feet. They can be shined up nicely too! Super high quality! Best daily dress shoes I have owned!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is accurate and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I've always been hesitant about buying shoes online. You always got to "try" before you buy, right? Especially with shoes. I hated the selections of men's dress shoes at the local mall and hated the prices even more. I ordered 9 1/2 size and these shoes were spot on. They fit my 9 1/2 foot just right. I like the quality of the shoe and they are comfortable. Being dress shoes and wanting to preserve the finish as long as possible, I would advise using a shoe horn.
customer_reviews.author: Old Mountain Biker

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but still flawed...
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. Not the most comfortable, but still not bad for dress shoes. I've used them periodically for the last few months. While they still look nice, they have started to make a sound when I walk. Not a squeak, but more of a swoosh sound. I read a review that these shows have a hollow sole/heel, which I'm guessing is causing the sound. While I like the shoes overall, I don't like to hear strange noses while I'm walking.
customer_reviews.author: CA Original

customer_reviews.title: The shoe fits comfortably and looks nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits comfortably and looks nice for the price. However, I sit at a desk all day long and don't wear these shoes out much and the sole still only lasted 9 months before it started pulling away from the shoe at the seem. After 11 months it separated completely in the back and split right down the middle of the sole where it tore away. So the price is good....but I got less than 1 yr of wear from them sitting at a desk all day. Their durability is of poor quality
customer_reviews.author: commoncents

customer_reviews.title: These are comfortable to walk in and fit people with wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and walk a lot at work, so these were perfect. They do tend to get a little hot during summer weather, so you have to factor that in. The way my feet contact the floor when I walk causes soft soled shoes like these to wear out fairly quickly, so I am price conscious. I watch these on CamelCamelCamel and purchase when the price drops.
customer_reviews.author: Calaveras Hopper

customer_reviews.title: ... long time but want to warn everyone of these poor quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: Haven't written a review in a long time but want to warn everyone of these poor quality shoes. I ordered these in November 2015 (Cordovan color) and started wearing them this March only to work and back. They feel great but after a few weeks the shoes exterior started cracking and the rear insoles by the back of the heal broke through and started collapsing. I am a regular sized guy and easy on all my shoes. Totally disappointed iin these shoes and feel ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Buckley

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these to try out & found them acceptable, but not anything exceptional. Grip on the soles is almost smooth, construction details are passable though time will tell if they were made to last. There's almost no cushioning in them which makes them a lower grade for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: John Bruell

customer_reviews.title: Finally shoes that ARE wide as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and a high instep and have been searching for dress shoes that are suitable for the ofice for over 6 months. None of the outlet stores had sufficiently wide shoes. The shoes look sharp and fit perfectly. For this price i'll be happy if i get 6 months out of them.
customer_reviews.author: bigmangomike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable When On Your Feet All Day!
customer_reviews.text: My son has been having me order these for years. He's an AMTRAK conductor & is on his feet from LA to Maricopa Az. 2 to 4 times a week & these shoes fit the bill. They come in black & have a defined heel & most important to him, they feel great all day. He highly recommends them to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: BLUELADY

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully better than the last pair.
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet. The last pair I had of these fit well. The problem was they did not last a year of moderate use before the soles split and let in the rain. It seemed at the time customer service did not know much about customer service and was well aware of the poor quality. This time around, I am expecting no better result but the top side wears well and looks decent. So if I get the same few months of wear I suppose the price is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: comfortable value shoe that wears out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Good points: 1) comfortable thanks to easily stretching leather, thick rubber soles, and large choice of sizes and widths 2) affordable - I paid $35 3) looks good, shiny and professional when new Bad points: 1) low durability, even for a $35 price point. This model used to resist normal wear and tear back 10 years ago. Recent versions have been downgraded with significantly thinner and cheaper materials. They wear out within a couple months 2) Appearance quickly becomes dull after wearing a few times 3) the soft leather easily scratches 4) the thick rubber sole wears out quickly. It becomes thinner by the day until holes pierce through 5) cheap laces that last a couple months at best
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfort with a dress shoe appearance.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to replace a worn out pair of the same size and model. I have wide feet and had overlooked that my original pair took a week or so to break in, due to the toe area being slightly cramped when new. When I order my next pair I will go up 1/2 size since these run a little narrow in the toe, even with the wide model. .
customer_reviews.author: XYZZY

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: My major complaint about these shoes is that they are impossible to find in a 3E/4E. The toe box is just a bit cramped, but after "wearing them in", the leather stretches. I've bought four pairs over the last few years, and generally, once they're broken in, I'm very happy with them. At less than $50/pr, it's cheaper to toss them than re-sole.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Del Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 4 or 5 pairs of these Dockers shoes in several colors. You can check my amazon purchases. The previous pairs were like good gloves and broke in and became very comfortable. These did not. I may no longer buy Dockers after this pair of shoes, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL CASUAL SHOE OR DRESS SHOE!
customer_reviews.text: I love these Docker shoes. I first bought a pair in 2001 in a Boston shoe store. They are very durable and I can wear them with a pair jeans or dress slacks. A sweater of dress shirt and sport coat. These shoes are very stylish and when you break them in, they will fit your feet perfectly. As mentioned I first bought a pair in 2001 and they have lasted me until 2019. This is my second pair. (PS...always find a shoe repair shop to put "plastic taps" on the heels and toes of your shoes. The will allow the heel and toes of the shoes to wear slower. Once worn, the taps can simply be replaced as needed).
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tee

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I used to love these shoes, but not anymore. I've been wearing this pair for less than 4 months. And the heel had a blowout. Not something huge, just a subtle hole on the inside of the heel. But it got bigger quickly and now, I look like Charlie Chaplin walking. With the air coming out, there is zero support and my left foot sinks down with every step. Not to mention the sound of the air squishing/swishing out! Sad to say this is my last pair of these. I guess it is true, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Kutzner

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe but narrow
customer_reviews.text: This Docker mens dress shoe looks very nice. The shoes look well made and would probably hold up nicely. But they are supposed to be wide and they are too narrow. If width is not an issue, they would be a good shoe. Also, they were shipped in a plastic bag and the box did not withstand the trip. Bad packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, got them a second time after 3 years wore out the last pair
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes three years ago and wore them to work often. As former military, I polished them to a reflective black mirror shine. They were very comfortable for walking concrete sidewalks, so when the first pair began to show wear, I got a second.
customer_reviews.author: Malarky51

customer_reviews.title: wears out after about a year. spend a little more and get something better.
customer_reviews.text: wears out after about a year. spend a little more and get something better. I work in an office and sit most of the day, so these shoes should not be worn out already. They fit well and looked good at first but they just didn't stand up to very light abuse.
customer_reviews.author: It'sJustMarty

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy! You'll regret it!!
customer_reviews.text: Worse pair of shoes ever bought. Each pair that I received seemed to have a shorter lifespan. The first pair lasted for like 3 months. The second pair lasted for less than a month and the replacement pair lasted literally two weeks. I use these like twice a week if that. And most of the time, I am seating. It would always seem to fall apart on the left foot heel area.I guess you get what you paid for in this case.
customer_reviews.author: MagFit777

customer_reviews.title: Great dress shoes that do not need to be broken in
customer_reviews.text: OK, so they may not be as durable as old-world crafted shoes, but they wear great right out of the box. I usually get 8-12 months out of mine and I wear them all day 5 days a week and to church on Sundays. The first place I notice wear is right around that trim piece that sits on the top of the opening for your foot. Get something in there a little more durable and I might get another year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Devin S Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Has like a microfilm coating on it... you scratch it and there goes the finish of the shoes.... it's unbelievable how they are allowed to get away with selling stuff like this.... that's why they continually buy from China so they can stick their hands more in our pockets such dishonesty
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: 5 star fit 2 star quality
customer_reviews.text: Where to start. Bought these in May and by August the leather on the toes is falling apart. Minimal abuse, wore them 6 days a week in an office and church. I had to color the spots with a sharpie because they look so beat up. Shined them up and they look new but worrying what else will fall apart. They fit great, once broken in will feel amazing. Quite comfortable. Better quality would be appreciated. Currently in the process of a refund from the seller. Not sure I'd buy again. 5 stars for comfort and look, but 2 for quality.
customer_reviews.author: AMDG2000

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but they need to last longer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these in 3 months. I wear them for an office job with light to moderate walking. The comfort, break in period, look, and price are excellent. 5 stars hands down. They are unwearable after day 90. It wore down and separated at the sole. I love the shoes but .... 90 days????
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had to send them back
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were for my son for work. They fit fine but when he walked the part where the stitching is on the front hurt him every time he walked. It just did not bend the way it should have. They are a good solid shoe though but just hurt him too much.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Good for few hours, look elsewhere if you need for longer.
customer_reviews.text: So I wear size 12 4e in most tennis shoes (asics/new balance). The 12 size is accurate and I get 4e just because my feet swell. So I got a 12 W (2e) for this dockers shoe. The 12 is actually a little too large for me I think 11 1/2 would've been right but the width is just fine. They are not really that comfortable to be walking around all day. However I just use these for chuch and maybe some special events (don't wear dress shoes for my job) so max maybe few hours in a day. For my purposes these are fine. If you need to wear dress shoes for longer period, I don't recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: jmp28621

customer_reviews.title: Really a nice made and great looking shoe for large sizes.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 15 wide, and let me tell you, it's super difficult to find anything quality in my size. These are perfect for me, have been wearing them for two days now and damn, it's amazing to have great quality shoes for work and a classy night out. I can't rave about these shoes enough, and for the price they are unbeatable. Really a great substantial shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan M.

customer_reviews.title: Finally! my dad found the most comfortable shoes!
customer_reviews.text: My dad had been looking for comfortable dressy shoes, the ones he used to buy were discontinued! We started looking till we found this one! My dad ordered the wide option, he’s a senior & he has diabetes so shoes have to be really comfortable! And they were...as expected, my dad loves them, they combine elegance and comfort! Really good product!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Soliman

customer_reviews.title: comfortable but not very stylish
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. I owned a pair of these for a few years and they were comfortable to wear. Once the shoes wore out I replaced them with a pair of clarks dress shoes that were comfortable, stylish, and a similar price.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: The squeaky shoe gets the attention
customer_reviews.text: If you like making grand entrances, having all eyes on you as you walk by, then these are the shoes for you! Stylish and comfortable, these will surely make your presentations pop. Nothing like strutting around the conference room, with every step the sound of squashing a small duckling. *Squish squish, squish squish* "If you'll kindly take your eyes off of my feet and back onto the presentation board."
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, Bad shoelaces
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are nice looking and comfortable, but the shoelaces that come with them are to big for the eyelets and too weak to withstand the friction that causes. After wearing the shoes a dozen or so times the shoelaces are totally frayed and I'm having to replace them. You'll like the shoes but order some replacement laces (36" long) to go with them.
customer_reviews.author: David Scroggins

customer_reviews.title: Dockers Men's Gordon Cap-Toe Oxford
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10 1/2 Wide (EE) in US men's size. Dockers makes a great shoe for people with back problems the soft cushion and classic look offer a comfortable alternative. I have other Dockers styles that fit very well in their 10 1/2 Wide size. These are more tapered and likely the cause for the wide not being quite wide enough. Once I have worn them enough to break them in I am satisfied they will be fine. I would suggest that if you are looking at a tapered shoe you may want to consider a bit wider size to compensate.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Cox, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, but will wear out if worn frequently
customer_reviews.text: These pair of shoes fit well, however, they are not well suited for frequent wear. I bought a pair this year and last year, and have used them as my daily work shoes. I live in NYC area and so, I must walk 2-3 miles a day in these shoes. After about 7 months of regular wear, the soles are completely worn out and require replacement, in both cases.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wingert

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking Shoes But Not Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: While these shoes look very sharp and were a great deal considering they are Dockers, the toe cap is extremely rigid. Even after more than a month of constant wear, my feet still get sore wearing these. Despite being very nice looking shoes, I would never buy again nor recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Krysztoff

customer_reviews.title: Not like first pair. Uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Second pair - not as comfortable. Loved first pair so much I thought I would make it easy this time. Ordered same size, 11 wide, but they feel different - not as soft. I might actually be generous with this star rating because I will not buy third pair. Have had them a while now and I thought they just needed to be broken in. Not so. Still uncomfortable. First pair was 2 or 3 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are excellent shoes. I wore them daily for work, switching between two pairs (one pair brown and the other black). They lasted about a year and a half for me, which is good for a fairly cheap pair of dress shoes. They did sustain scuffs fairly easily because they are a cheaper leather, but shoe polish covered it pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Hurts putting them on. Looks and feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them and returned them. Just weren't for me. The leather is hard and cheap and getting into the shoe hurt. The stitch work looks cheap too. Gonna spend like 50 more bucks to get a better quality leather shoe.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great value (but buy some shoelaces too)
customer_reviews.text: Great genuine leather uppers at a price point that usually delivers plastic. Very comfortable after a short break-in. Have had several pairs over the past 8 years, and just bought both the black and brown. Weak point is the ridiculous shoelaces. Be prepared to replace them within 30 days. Or, better yet, re-string them prior to first use and spare yourself the aggravation. Such a minor point won't cause me to deduct a star from this great value, but come on Dockers this has been a weak spot for years now.
customer_reviews.author: bbjones1979

customer_reviews.title: Heel fell apart in just over a month :(
customer_reviews.text: These were great for about a month. Working in an office environment the heel developed a crack and now flops to the side. Also had to exchange the first pair because they run small even in WIDE width. BE AWARE the soles are all rubber and the heel is air filled, once the heel cracked the heel went flat and it got worse from there. I expect a pair of shoes to last more than a month, these were terrible and while the upper still looks great, the sole is an absolute joke, would have returned these but the heel managed to last until a few days past the return period. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of these shoes. They have proven to be just as comfortable and durable as some others that cost 2 or 3 times as much. I have serious pronation, but the heels wear very well. Real leather, not that bonded stuff.
customer_reviews.author: dougja

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe. Cap toe keeps it looking fresh.
customer_reviews.text: These are, seriously, the only dress shoe I'll wear. They look nice. The cap toe keeps the tip looking fresh and solid. They wear well. They're economical. If I wear them out, they're inexpensive enough for me to buy another pair as needed. Have worn this same shoe for years - yeah, I know - but if it works, it works.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganTraveler

customer_reviews.title: I've bought these shoes twice. For the first pair ...
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these shoes twice. For the first pair, I started having issues with the heel of the shoe about five months after purchasing them - I wear these every day, so part of me expected erosion of the rubber heel, which eventually started letting water into the shoe itself on rainy days. I threw them out, and bought a second pair a month ago - and the heel, on the same right shoe, is completely coming apart from the rest of the shoe. For the price I spent on these, I would expect some level of quality - Dockers clearly doesn't know what the word means.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: like a bunch of air is being forced to exit ...
customer_reviews.text: For some reason the right shoe makes a 'swoosh' sound when I walk, like a bunch of air is being forced to exit a single point. It does not do this with my left foot and I have never had this issue before with any other shoe. Maybe this means the shoe is slightly too large for me. Otherwise I like the look and feel of the shoes; I just have to walk a little differently when wearing them in order to prevent this silly sound from occurring.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall M Tebben

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these at the last minute for my husband to walk his daughter down the aisle. Perfect fit and no breaking in needed. Was on his feet for 5 hours and no pain or blisters. Very nice looking and kept their shape. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Look good, feel good, priced great
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I recently bought a $150 pair of work shoes from Brazil. They fit terrible and hurt. Out of frustration for a quick fix I decided to order a $45 pair of Dockers and they fit great, are comfortable, and look nice with full leather uppers. While comfortable out of the box they will take a few days to really develop a break at the ball of the foot. Rub them down with some good leather conditioner to help. Fit for 9.5D was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Scuffs Easy, but very durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I was fed up with buying $100 expensive name brand loafers/dress shoes just to have the sole separate from them in only months. I saw these and, even though they're fairly ugly, they really get the job done with their durability. They scuff fairly easily, but that's nothing a touch-up can't fix! Really happy with this purchase, would recommend. :)
customer_reviews.author: D&A

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful color with a very versatile style that can be worn with a “Very Dressy” Dress Code, “Dressy” Dress Code, & “Dressy Casual” Dress Code... PLUS - They are very comfortable (so much so that this is the 3rd pair I’ve bought for my Husband)!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn 😁

customer_reviews.title: This One Hurts
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this shoe. I thought my first pair was uncomfortable because it was a half size to small. Wrong! This Gordan Cap is just stiff and uncomfortable after a month of break in. I've bought a number of Dockers shoes in different styles over the past 10 years or so. I have always liked them and that's why I tried a second pair of these. Not again. They look really good, but they are never comfortable. For those of you old enough to remember these are the going to church shoes you had to wear once a week. And pinched your feet the entire time. Two stars because they do look good.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger

customer_reviews.title: Ohhhh, the pain I feel with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I HATE these shoes - they are extremely uncomfortable - I've never worn such an uncomfortable shoe. After wearing them for a few months, I hoped they would eventually wear in. The leather is extremely stiff - the top of the shoe folds onto my foot with every step and causes pain. They don't breath at all. The only good thing about them as they are very anti-slip. Good luck if you're buying these - don't keep them as long as I did before complaining about them so you might have a chance of getting your money back.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: One and a half year Review
customer_reviews.text: I've been happy with the shoes. There are two problems though that develop over time. First is the rubber soles cracked where they bend the most. You'll have to put rubber glue in the crack to stop water coming in. Second is one lace broke on the outside but internally its still holding. When it breaks completely I'll have a problem because the laces are unique for Dockers. It'll be hard finding a match. The upper part of the shoes is still in decent shape. My plan now is to use them for longer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for men with wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I'd like the brogue look ....too dressy. I mean I want to wear nice jeans with my casual shoes...these are more to wear with dress pants to Dockers or linen. Great fit for men with wide feet. Nicely made
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe But Laces Don't Last
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe and have bought it before. The only complaint I have are the Laces break pretty quickly. They're thicker laces so when you buy alternate laces they don't work as well. I would recommend buying the shoe but you should also get an extra pair of laces for them.
customer_reviews.author: Iron Chef

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable leather dress shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I did a great deal of research before finally mak8ng this purchase. I have never purchased shoes online for my husband before. Was looking for a comfortable leather dress at an affordable price. This goes beyond my expectations. The sizing was perfect, very comfortable, and they're super sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Sone

customer_reviews.title: Has Dockers changed manufactures?  It as good as past shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes.Don't seem to last as long as my older ones a few years ago. shoe strings are like yarn, they come untied easily which requires frequent retieing. They tend to start looking old sooner than those I bought in the past.
customer_reviews.author: GMUNCH

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my feet
customer_reviews.text: Slightly small for the size. These shoes have very little internal padding. The first time I wore them, I walked only 5 blocks and my feet were wrecked. The back of my heels were bleeding (blood stains on socks), I had a huge blister on the bottom of one of my feet, and I was in pain for a couple days while attending jury duty. I wish I were exaggerating but I'm not.
customer_reviews.author: vgsmike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable soles uncomfortable tongue.
customer_reviews.text: The tongue of the shoe makes a painful imprint when worn. May cause chaffing. Purchased for someone: Really like the shoes. Great fit for work hours. But when you get off work, take them off. The sole is very comfortable. I just cant wear them for an extended period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my husband was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has wide feet and he has trouble finding shoes that fit him comfortably. These shoes made him very happy. The fit, the style and the quality were perfect. A well made pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Great looks and comfort
customer_reviews.text: These are great every day business shoes. They are affordable, comfortable, and last a very long time. I wore my last pair nearly every day for at least 5 years before they started to wear out. When going on business trips where I had to walk all over airports and then all over a city, I actually preferred these to anything else. They do start off a little stiff and need to be broken in, but they quickly become very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lars SveenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Eyes for shoe string cuts shoe string in about 3 weeks of wear
customer_reviews.text: This is at least the third pair of this particular shoe that I have had. All others have been ok. This one has a top eye for the shoe lace that cuts the lace, leaving about a 3 week life in the lace. After about one week the lace is visibly seen as jagged by everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It looks good but wears horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the look is good. No complaints. However, there's something about the material that contains heat and moisture like garbage bags. It's uncomfortable to wear it for periods longer than an hour. It's not so bad when it's cold. However, on warmer days, it's exactly how it sounds like. If you want to test it, just put your feet in a thick garbage bag and then put your shoes on. Voila. A perfect heat and moisture containment system.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Teodosio

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My son has a size 17 foot and its impossible to find shoes that fit him in stores and many shoes we buy on line dont fit comfortably. That was not the case with these, my son said they fit great and cause no pain
customer_reviews.author: S. Fritz

customer_reviews.title: I need a more comfortable dress shoe to replace the old wingtips I wore ...
customer_reviews.text: As a now (ahem) senior citizen, I need a more comfortable dress shoe to replace the old wingtips I wore for most of my career. I don't wear these daily, but they are great for occasional formal functions. I wore them all day for two days at a recent business conference and they worked just fine. They are very comfortable and I am pleased at how sharp they look.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Willis

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased for the money. Not suitable for a high official or millionaire, they are Dockers after all. But for me that is a casual guy that still has to meet office dress code they are great. I could probably wear all day quite comfortably, even standing a lot like an teacher or store clerk. Would buy again. Probably not as nice or long lasting as higher price shoes but for most people and frequent wear they work well, I think they are a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Chickory

customer_reviews.title: Great! Multiple pairs bought.
customer_reviews.text: Posting this review for my Dad, so sorry I haven't actually worn these. Due to his work, he has worn dress shoes daily/most of the day for years and is on/off his feet regularly. He is a huge fan of these shoes and just bought 4 more pairs (he bought 4 pairs of these shoes previously but I forget when this was, my best guess was a few years ago). They may not be the best looking pair of shoes, but if you need an affordable, relatively good looking, comfortable pair of dress shoes that will last a long time than these are what you are looking for. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second pair as comfortable as the first
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes before at a brick and mortar store. The shoes lasted from May 2014 until August 2015, while being worn an average of four days a week 50 weeks a year. These shoes were comfortable after breaking in quickly and maintain their looks, although they do crease across the top of the foot. Shoes also have a rubber nonslip sole. I just ordered my second pair from Amazon, which I have worn for a week. They fit as well as the first pair. To provide more cushioning and arch support, I put third part insoles into these shoes. Be warned that when these shoes wear out, they seem to go all at once (soles, seams, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes with minor flaw that can be worked out
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe. Would have given 5 stars but there is a crease at the top of the shoe (between the foot and toes) so when you walk the shoe folds in and makes walking uncomfortable. I think the more I walk in them the better they will get. Shoe is very shiny and constructed very well. I will purchase again but I think I will get the "wide" size next time. I feel like this would help the "crease" issue mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Some years ago I purchased a pair of Docker shoes from a local store. They were the best fitting dress shoe I have ever worn. So it was easy for me to purchase more of these shoes from Amazon because I knew the fit would be great and the shoe will wear well for some time to come.
customer_reviews.author: RRR

customer_reviews.title: I Love this shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this same shoe now for over 5 years!!! I buy two pair about once a year in black and oxford and the consistence in fit is the same every time. After about a two or three day break-in period, they are very comfortable to wear. The leather tops seem to last forever, but I do tend to wear down the rubber heel after about a year (not sure if it's the way I walk or normal wear and tear). I wear these to work everyday with a pair of dockers, and also wear them when dressed in a suit and tie. They look great and feel great.
customer_reviews.author: John Snow

customer_reviews.title: Good comfort after broken in
customer_reviews.text: This pair is the second set of Dockers oxfords that I have owned. The last set lasted over five years with every other day wear during the work week. I liked them so much that I immediately ordered a replacement set when they finally got too worn. The new pair took me about two weeks to break in, because it takes awhile for the second layer of leather on the toe of the shoe to soften up. Now that I'm past the breaking in stage, they are extremely comfortable. I'm very happy with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Loeb

product_meta.title: Dockers Men’s Gordon Leather Oxford Dress Shoe
feature_bullets: Padded collars add an extra layer of comfort
Flexible construction for all day wear
Accepted by the American Podiatric Medical Association for quality and effectiveness in allowing for normal foot function and promoting good foot health.
Durable, siped rubber outsole for maximum traction on wet surfaces.
